There were letters enclosed in the loaf, in which she assured the rebels that she would make strong efforts in aid of their laudable undertakings3 let them only come to the monastery, slay all the guards that would resist; that things had come to such a pass, that there was no happy auspices for them without shed- ding blood. The rebels in like manner transmitted their answers to Sophia in a loaf. The thing was done several times and the soldiers had no suspicion of it-—so ingenious is malice in plotting mischief.
